p: Agarwood from Vietnam, Indonesia, and Malaysia was purchased from SanKeshu Medicinal Materials Market, Harbin, Heilongjiang Province, China, and authenticated using scanning electron microscopy (Quanta 200, FEI, Eindhoven, The Netherlands) by Yongzhi Cui, Northeast Forestry University. A. sinensis (diameter, 8.5 cm) was obtained from Guangdong. Different parts were separated and stored at −20 °C, and then underwent water distillation or Soxhlet extraction for 48 h after smashing. Climatic information about agarwood from different regions is shown in Table 5.
